Welcome to Contact manager FastAPi’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.custom_middleware(request: Request, call_next)¶
async main.errors_handling(request: Request, call_next)¶

The errors_handling function is a middleware that catches any exception raised by the application. It returns an error response with status code 500 and a JSON body containing the reason for the error.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object

  • call_next – Pass the request to the next handler in the pipeline

Returns:

A jsonresponse object with a 500 status code and the reason for the error

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If there are no results, then we know something is wrong with our connection.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.root(request: Request)¶

The root function is the entry point for the application. It returns a TemplateResponse object, which renders an HTML template using Jinja2. The template is located in templates/index.html and uses data from the request object to render itself.

Parameters:

request – Request: Get the request object that is sent from the client

Returns:

A templateresponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, such as connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A coroutine, so it must be awaited

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(user: User, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The create function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the token

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact from the database based on the user and contact id.
Args:

user (User): The User object that is requesting to get a Contact. contact_id (int): The id of the Contact being requested by the User.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id of the contact that we want to get

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before starting to return rows

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of contacts for a given user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The remove function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • contact_id – int: Specify which contact to remove from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was just removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.set_favorite(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactFavoriteModel, db: Session)¶
The set_favorite function is used to set a contact as favorite or not.
Args:

user (User): The current user. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be updated. body (ContactFavoriteModel): A model containing the new value for is_favorite field in Contact table.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is making the request

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactFavoriteModel: Pass the is_favorite value to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶
The update function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

user (User): The user who is making the request. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): A ContactModel object containing all of the information for this new contact, including an id field that will be ignored by this function.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact by id

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object, which is the same as the one we get from get_contact_by_id

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Search¶

async src.repository.search.get_birthday_list(user: User, shift: int, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_birthday_list function takes in a user, shift, and db. It returns a list of contacts that have birthdays within the next ‘shift’ days.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is currently logged in

  • shift – int: Determine how many days in the future to look for birthdays

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next ‘shift’ days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_contact_by_email(user: User, email: str, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contact_by_email function takes in a user, an email string, and a database session. It then queries the database for all contacts that match the given email string. The function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user id

  • email – str: Search for a contact by email

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_contact_by_firstname(user: User, firstname: str, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
The get_contact_by_firstname function returns a list of contacts that match the firstname parameter.

The function takes in a user object, firstname string and database session as parameters.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id of the logged in user

  • firstname – str: Search for a contact by firstname

  • db – Session: Create a database session, which is used to query the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the firstname given

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_contact_by_lastname(user: User, lastname: str, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
The get_contact_by_lastname function returns a list of contacts that match the lastname parameter.

The user_id is used to ensure that only contacts belonging to the current user are returned.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id from the user object

  • lastname – str: Filter the contacts by lastname

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A list of contacts with the given lastname

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_contact_by_phone(user: User, phone: str, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
The get_contact_by_phone function returns a list of contacts that match the phone number provided.
Args:

user (User): The user who is making the request. phone (str): The phone number to search for in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

  • phone – str: Search for a contact by phone number

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the user’s id and phone number

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_users_by_partial_info(user: User, partial_info: str, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
The get_users_by_partial_info function takes in a user and partial_info,

then returns a list of contacts that match the partial_info.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • partial_info – str: Search for a user by their first name, last name, email or phone number

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Create a new user object

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to get from our database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object or none if no user with the given email exists

Doc-author:

Trelent

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Get the user from the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that will be passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_password(user: User, new_password: str, db: Session) → None¶

The update_password function takes in a user object, a new password string, and the database session. It then updates the user’s password to be equal to the new_password string.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass in the user object that is being updated

  • new_password – str: Pass the new password to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

The update_reset_token function updates the password reset token for a user.

Parameters:

  • reset_token – Update the password_reset_token field in the user table

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. refresh_token (str): The new refresh token to store in the database. db (Session): A connection to our Postgres database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • refresh_token – Update the user’s refresh_token in the database

  • db – Session: Update the database with the new refresh token

Returns:

The user object with the updated refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user from the database

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.favorite_contact(body: ContactFavoriteModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The favorite_contact function is used to set a contact as favorite or not.
The function takes the following parameters:

body (ContactFavoriteModel): A ContactFavoriteModel object containing the new favorite status of the contact. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be updated. This parameter is optional and defaults to 1 if not provided, but must be greater than 0 when provided. It can also be passed in via path variable using /{contact_id}. If it’s passed in via both path variable and query string, then an error will occur.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactFavoriteModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. The function takes in an optional contact_id parameter, which defaults to 1 if not provided. It also takes in a db Session object and current_user User object as parameters, both of which are injected by FastAPI.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url path

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is logged in

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Skip a number of records

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The deleted contact

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id and a body as input, and returns the updated contact. If no such contact exists, it raises an HTTPException with status code 404.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact model to the function

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id in the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Search¶

async src.routes.search.find_contacts_by_partial_info(partial_info: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The find_contacts_by_partial_info function is used to find contacts by partial information.

The function takes in a string of partial information and returns a list of users that match the search criteria.

Parameters:

  • partial_info – str: Search for users by their name, email or phone number

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.search.get_birthday_list(shift: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_birthday_list function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.
The shift parameter is used to determine which week to return:

0 = this week, 1 = next week, 2 = two weeks from now, etc.

Parameters:

  • shift – int: Determine the shift in days from today

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user id of the current logged in user

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthday in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user object, which is a user instance

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file that has been uploaded to the server. It also takes in a User object and Session object as dependencies.

The function first configures cloudinary with our cloudinary account information, then uploads the file to

our RestContacts folder on Cloudinary using its public_id (which is set to be equal to RestContacts/username).

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository function

Returns:

A user object, but the avatar is not updated in the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not. If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular User object

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that the email is now confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies them against the database, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.password_reset_confirm(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The password_reset_confirm function is used to reset a user’s password.

It takes in the token from the email sent to the user and returns a new token that can be used by the client to update their password.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A reset_password_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A json object containing the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to reset their password. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user associated with that email address and sends an email containing a link for resetting their password.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes in a UserModel object, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using Argon2 and stored as such. A confirmation email is sent to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message and the new_user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.update_password(request: ResetPassword, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_password function takes a ResetPassword object and updates the user’s password. It first checks if the reset_password_token is valid, then it checks if the new password matches the confirm password field. If all of these conditions are met, it will update the user’s password in our database.

Parameters:

  • request – ResetPassword: Get the token and new password from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A message that says &quot;password successfully updated&quot;

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY, which is stored in the .env file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also stored in the .env file.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email,

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s data to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email associated with the refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, otherwise raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of ‘email_token’. If so, it returns the email address from the payload’s sub field. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid scope for token&quot;. If there is any other error in decoding or validating the JWT, we raise another HTTPException with status code 422 (Unprocess

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token that is sent in the email to verify

Returns:

The email from the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that we want to hash

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • plain_password – Take in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Check if the password is correct

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

class src.services.auth.AuthPassword¶

Bases: object

get_hash_password(password: str)¶

The get_hash_password function takes a password as an argument and returns the hashed version of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object’s hash method, which uses bcrypt to generate a secure hash.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password entered by the user to be hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(password: str, hashed_password: str)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the verify method of the pwd_context object to check if they match.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that the user has entered

  • hashed_password – str: Compare the password that is being passed in with the hashed_password

Returns:

True if the password is correct, and false otherwise

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str, payload: dict)¶
The send_email function is used to send an email to a user.
It takes in the following parameters:

  • email: The recipient’s email address.

  • username: The recipient’s username. This will be used for personalization purposes in the template body of the message being sent out.

  • host: The hostname of where this service is running on (e.g., http://localhost). This will be used for personalization purposes in the template body of the message being sent out, as well as for generating a link that can be clicked by users to verify their emails and complete registration/password reset processes

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

  • payload – dict: Pass the subject, template_name and other parameters

Returns:

A coroutine object, which is a special kind of iterator

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Role¶

class src.services.role.RoleAccess(allowed_roles: List[Role])¶
